author: djrtwo
content: (1) this is correct. And if the transfer doesn't make it, the receipt will not be marked as consumed and the withdrawal will still be in limbo. It can then be tried again with, e.g. more gas or whatever the failure was

author: djrtwo
content: (2) a precise ETH amount would be be specified in the withdrawal receipt tree when the beacon chain withdrawal is initiated. Then the consumption of the receipt on eth1 would transfer precisely that amount

author: djrtwo
content:
(1) I need to cut a release. There is no intention of changing what is in there, but I'll put up a minor release PR for final review and cut the release in next two days
(2) yes. I just wanted to note that in the final end of the flow (withdrawn balance heading to eth1, it is a very similar code path. Both specify an eth1 addr (0x01 is just a pre-commit, 0x00 will do it at the end) and both go into a receipt tree to be consumed in eth1
